question.body: When looking at the histology of the renal tubule and collecting ducts, what is a common component between the proximal convoluted tubule, thick ascending limb, most of the distal convoluted tubule, collecting duct, and last part of distal convoluted tubule?

multiple_choice.choice: They all contain simple cuboidal epithelial cells.
They all have conspicuous brush borders of microvilli.
They all contain simple squamous epithelial cells.

response.feedback: Correct. The proximal convoluted tubule, thick ascending limb, most of the distal convoluted tubule, collecting duct, and last part of distal convoluted tubule all contain simple cuboidal epithelial cells.
Incorrect. Proximal convoluted tubule has conspicuous brush borders of microvilli.
Incorrect. Descending limb and thin ascending limb contain simple squamous epithelial cells.
Incorrect. Collecting duct and last part of distal convoluted tubule contain intercalated cells.

multiple_choice.choice: The proximal convoluted tubule is the only area that contains simple cuboidal epithelial cells.
The proximal convoluted tubule is the only area that contains a conspicuous brush border of microvilli.
The proximal convoluted tubule is the only area that contains simple squamous epithelial cells.
The proximal convoluted tubule is the only area that contains intercalated cells.
